title: RS21396
content: Links to basic static maps of Iraq and the Middle East region are provided in alphabetical order, with the Perry-Castañeda Library website offering a wide range of Iraq maps. The University of Texas website includes maps from the CIA and historical maps, while the Center for Strategic and International Studies report features maps on the Iraq War. The Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) creates maps of various parts of the world and makes some available for viewing by the general public on the Internet. Global Security is an online resource that provides background information and news on defense, space, intelligence, WMD, and homeland security issues. United Nations (U.N.) Iraq: Web Portal for U.N. Agencies Working in Iraq offers U.N. maps. The U.N. Iraq Web Portal provides maps categorized into Geographic and Thematic sections, searchable through the Map Catalogue. The Department of Defense's "Measuring Security and Stability in Iraq" reports, discontinued after June 2010, offer historical data including public views on security and daily hours of electrical power per province. The New York Times offers an interactive map of post-surge Baghdad neighborhoods. The ReliefWeb website, a project of the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs, provides information and maps on areas requiring humanitarian relief, including Iraq. Maps on the site date from 2001 to 2010, with details such as individuals returning to Iraq after displacement and projects funded by Japan ODA loans. General Petraeus's 2007 report to Congress on the situation in Iraq includes maps, such as the "State of Al Qaeda Iraq." The Special Inspector General for Iraq Reconstruction (SIGIR) also offers publications on Iraq's reconstruction efforts. The Special Inspector General for Iraq Reconstruction (SIGIR) provides quarterly reports to the U.S. Congress, including maps on Iraqi political protests, ISPO/USACE projects, and security incidents. The United Nations website offers a reference map of Iraq in a one-page PDF.
